ArticleTitle.sentence: Cross-linking CD40 on B cells rapidly activates nuclear factor-kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: The B cell-associated surface molecule CD40 functions to regulate B cell responses.

AbstractText.sentence: Cross-linking CD40 on B cells can lead to homotypic cell adhesion, IL-6 production, and, in combination with cytokines, to Ig isotype switching.

AbstractText.sentence: Little is known about how the very early events induced by CD40 cross-linking link to cellular responses.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study, we demonstrate that nuclear factor (NF)-kappa B and NF-kappa B-like transcription factors are activated after cross-linking CD40 on resting human tonsillar B cells and on B cell lines.

AbstractText.sentence: The activation is rapid and is mediated through a tyrosine kinase-dependent pathway.

AbstractText.sentence: The complexes detected in electrophoretic mobility shift assays contain p50, p65 (RelA), c-Rel, and most likely other components.
By using transient transfection assays, we found that cross-linking CD40 supports NF-kappa B-dependent gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Our results define the NF-kappa B system as an intermediate event in CD40 signaling and suggest that the CD40 pathway can influence the expression of B cell-associated genes with NF-kappa B consensus sites.

event.clue: Our results define the NF-kappa B system as an intermediate event in CD40 signaling and suggest that the CD40 pathway can influence the expression of B cell-associated genes with NF-kappa B consensus sites.
